availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Casey (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Nancy King Casey in Harrison County, Kentucky, in March 1820. Father of Alexander C. Casey, Ellen Casey, Nancy Casey, Sarah Casey, Thomas Casey, Frances Casey, and Mildred Casey. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 72B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 376.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 675.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 128A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216881.
